Discovering Endpoint Devices.name: Discovering Endpoint Devices
Discovering Endpoint Devices.description: Mechanisms to discover and classify endpoint devices using active and passive collectors.

sub_concepts.name: Passive Collectors
sub_concepts.description: Collectors triggered by network or timer events.

sub_concepts.name: User Agent Collector
sub_concepts.description: Uses HTTP User Agent data to classify devices.

parameters.name: user_agent_data
constraints: Must be captured from network traffic

sub_concepts.name: DHCP Collector
sub_concepts.description: Uses DHCP fingerprinting for endpoint classification.

parameters.name: dhcp_forwarding
constraints: Switches must forward DHCP packets to PPS appliance

sub_concepts.name: Network Infrastructure Device Collector
sub_concepts.description: Fetches ARP/CAM tables from network devices using SNMP or SSH.

sub_concepts.name: Active Collectors
sub_concepts.description: Collectors initiated by the Profiler for granular profiling.

sub_concepts.name: MDM Collector
sub_concepts.description: Integrates with Mobile Device Management platforms to retrieve endpoint details.

parameters.name: mdm_server
constraints: Must be a valid MDM server

sub_concepts.name: WMI Collector
sub_concepts.description: Uses WMI to collect detailed information about Windows endpoints.

parameters.name: wmi_credentials
constraints: Must be valid domain administrator credentials

parameters.name: deep_scan
constraints: Enabling deep scan increases resource usage

test_scenarios.scenario: Discover endpoint devices using passive collectors under normal network conditions
preconditions: Passive collector is configured and enabled
test_steps: Start the passive collector service
Monitor network traffic for endpoint device discovery
Verify discovered devices are classified correctly
expected_results: Passive collector identifies all endpoint devices in the network
Devices are classified accurately based on predefined rules

test_scenarios.scenario: Discover endpoint devices using active collectors with valid configuration
preconditions: Active collector is configured with valid parameters
test_steps: Start the active collector service
Initiate active scans to discover endpoint devices
Verify discovered devices are classified correctly
expected_results: Active collector identifies all endpoint devices in the network
Devices are classified accurately based on predefined rules

test_scenarios.scenario: Handle static IPs during endpoint discovery using passive collectors
preconditions: Passive collector is configured and enabled
Static IPs are present in the network
test_steps: Start the passive collector service
Monitor network traffic for endpoint device discovery
Verify devices with static IPs are discovered and classified
expected_results: Passive collector successfully identifies devices with static IPs
Devices are classified accurately based on predefined rules

test_scenarios.scenario: Handle static IPs during endpoint discovery using active collectors
preconditions: Active collector is configured with valid parameters
Static IPs are present in the network
test_steps: Start the active collector service
Initiate active scans to discover endpoint devices
Verify devices with static IPs are discovered and classified
expected_results: Active collector successfully identifies devices with static IPs
Devices are classified accurately based on predefined rules

test_scenarios.scenario: Simulate network outage during passive collector operation
preconditions: Passive collector is configured and enabled
test_steps: Start the passive collector service
Simulate a network outage
Monitor collector behavior during and after the outage
expected_results: Passive collector gracefully handles the network outage
No incorrect classifications or crashes occur
Collector resumes normal operation once the network is restored

test_scenarios.scenario: Simulate network outage during active collector operation
preconditions: Active collector is configured with valid parameters
test_steps: Start the active collector service
Simulate a network outage
Monitor collector behavior during and after the outage
expected_results: Active collector gracefully handles the network outage
No incorrect classifications or crashes occur
Collector resumes normal operation once the network is restored

test_scenarios.scenario: Test integration between passive and active collectors for endpoint discovery
preconditions: Passive and active collectors are configured and enabled
test_steps: Start both passive and active collector services
Monitor endpoint discovery and classification
Verify results from both collectors are consistent and complementary
expected_results: Passive and active collectors work together seamlessly
Endpoint devices are discovered and classified accurately
No duplicate or conflicting classifications occur

test_scenarios.scenario: Measure performance impact of active collectors under high network load
preconditions: Active collector is configured with valid parameters
test_steps: Start the active collector service
Simulate high network load
Monitor system performance and collector behavior
expected_results: Active collector maintains accurate endpoint discovery and classification
System performance remains within acceptable thresholds

test_scenarios.scenario: Measure performance impact of passive collectors under high network load
preconditions: Passive collector is configured and enabled
test_steps: Start the passive collector service
Simulate high network load
Monitor system performance and collector behavior
expected_results: Passive collector maintains accurate endpoint discovery and classification
System performance remains within acceptable thresholds

test_scenarios.scenario: Validate error handling for invalid active collector configuration
preconditions: Active collector is configured with invalid parameters
test_steps: Attempt to start the active collector service
Monitor system logs and error messages
expected_results: Active collector fails to start with appropriate error messages
No unexpected behavior or crashes occur

Profiler Configuration.name: Profiler Configuration
Profiler Configuration.description: Settings and options to configure the Profiler for device discovery and management.

sub_concepts.name: Basic Profiler Configuration
sub_concepts.description: Initial setup for the Profiler.

sub_concepts.name: Advanced Profiler Configuration
sub_concepts.description: Advanced settings for granular profiling.

test_scenarios.scenario: Validate basic configuration with valid parameters
preconditions: User has necessary permissions to configure the Profiler
test_steps: Navigate to the Profiler Configuration page
Enter valid basic configuration parameters (e.g., device discovery interval, network range)
Save the configuration
expected_results: Configuration is saved successfully
Profiler operates as expected with the configured parameters

test_scenarios.scenario: Validate advanced configuration with valid parameters
preconditions: User has necessary permissions to configure the Profiler
test_steps: Navigate to the Advanced Profiler Configuration page
Enter valid advanced configuration parameters (e.g., custom device filters, advanced network settings)
Save the configuration
expected_results: Configuration is saved successfully
Profiler operates as expected with the advanced settings

test_scenarios.scenario: Validate configuration with boundary values
preconditions: User has necessary permissions to configure the Profiler
test_steps: Navigate to the Profiler Configuration page
Enter boundary values for configuration parameters (e.g., minimum and maximum values for discovery interval, smallest and largest network range)
Save the configuration
expected_results: Configuration is saved successfully
Profiler operates correctly within the boundary values

test_scenarios.scenario: Handle invalid inputs for basic configuration
preconditions: User has necessary permissions to configure the Profiler
test_steps: Navigate to the Profiler Configuration page
Enter invalid values for basic configuration parameters (e.g., negative discovery interval, malformed network range)
Attempt to save the configuration
expected_results: Error messages are displayed for invalid inputs
Configuration is not saved

test_scenarios.scenario: Handle invalid inputs for advanced configuration
preconditions: User has necessary permissions to configure the Profiler
test_steps: Navigate to the Advanced Profiler Configuration page
Enter invalid values for advanced configuration parameters (e.g., unsupported device filters, invalid network settings)
Attempt to save the configuration
expected_results: Error messages are displayed for invalid inputs
Configuration is not saved

test_scenarios.scenario: Integration test with device discovery module
test_steps: Configure the Profiler with valid parameters for device discovery
Trigger device discovery
Verify that discovered devices match the configured parameters
expected_results: Devices are discovered as per the configured parameters
No unexpected devices are discovered

test_scenarios.scenario: Performance test under advanced configuration settings
preconditions: User has necessary permissions to configure the Profiler
test_steps: Configure the Profiler with complex advanced settings (e.g., multiple custom filters, large network ranges)
Trigger device discovery and management processes
Measure the time taken and resource utilization
expected_results: Profiler performs within acceptable time limits
Resource utilization remains within acceptable thresholds

test_scenarios.scenario: Edge case test with maximum number of devices in discovery
preconditions: User has necessary permissions to configure the Profiler
test_steps: Configure the Profiler to discover the maximum number of devices supported
Trigger device discovery
Verify the system behavior and discovered devices
expected_results: Profiler successfully discovers the maximum number of devices
System remains stable and responsive

Profiler Reports.name: Profiler Reports
Profiler Reports.description: Reporting and dashboard features for device profiling.

sub_concepts.name: Dashboard
sub_concepts.description: Displays an overview of device profiling status.

sub_concepts.name: Report Scheduling
sub_concepts.description: Schedules email notifications for profiling reports.

test_scenarios.scenario: Validate dashboard displays accurate profiling data
preconditions: Device profiling data exists in the system
User has access to the dashboard
test_steps: Log in to the application
Navigate to the Profiler Dashboard
Verify the displayed profiling data matches the database records
expected_results: Dashboard displays accurate profiling data as per the database records

test_scenarios.scenario: Verify report scheduling with boundary date values
preconditions: User has access to the report scheduling feature
test_steps: Log in to the application
Navigate to the Report Scheduling section
Schedule a report with the earliest possible date
Schedule a report with the latest possible date
expected_results: Report is successfully scheduled with the earliest possible date
Report is successfully scheduled with the latest possible date

test_scenarios.scenario: Handle invalid email address for report notifications
preconditions: User has access to the report scheduling feature
test_steps: Log in to the application
Navigate to the Report Scheduling section
Enter an invalid email address for notifications
Attempt to schedule the report
expected_results: System displays an error message indicating the email address is invalid

test_scenarios.scenario: Verify integration between dashboard and report scheduling
preconditions: Device profiling data exists in the system
User has access to both dashboard and report scheduling features
test_steps: Log in to the application
Navigate to the Profiler Dashboard
Schedule a report based on the displayed profiling data
Verify the scheduled report reflects the same data as the dashboard
expected_results: Scheduled report matches the profiling data displayed on the dashboard

test_scenarios.scenario: Test dashboard refresh performance under high data load
preconditions: System contains a large volume of profiling data
User has access to the dashboard
test_steps: Log in to the application
Navigate to the Profiler Dashboard
Trigger a manual refresh of the dashboard
Measure the time taken for the refresh to complete
expected_results: Dashboard refresh completes within the acceptable performance threshold

test_scenarios.scenario: Validate report scheduling with missing required fields
preconditions: User has access to the report scheduling feature
test_steps: Log in to the application
Navigate to the Report Scheduling section
Attempt to schedule a report without filling in required fields
expected_results: System prevents scheduling and displays error messages for missing required fields

test_scenarios.scenario: Verify email notification reliability for scheduled reports
preconditions: User has scheduled a report with a valid email address
test_steps: Log in to the application
Navigate to the Report Scheduling section
Schedule a report with a valid email address
Wait for the report to be generated and email notification to be sent
expected_results: Email notification is sent successfully to the provided email address

test_scenarios.scenario: Test dashboard refresh performance with minimal data load
preconditions: User has access to the dashboard
test_steps: Log in to the application
Navigate to the Profiler Dashboard
Trigger a manual refresh of the dashboard
Measure the time taken for the refresh to complete
expected_results: Dashboard refresh completes quickly under minimal data load

test_scenarios.scenario: Handle scheduling reports with unsupported file formats
preconditions: User has access to the report scheduling feature
test_steps: Log in to the application
Navigate to the Report Scheduling section
Attempt to schedule a report with an unsupported file format
expected_results: System displays an error message indicating the file format is unsupported

test_scenarios.scenario: Verify dashboard data consistency after multiple refreshes
preconditions: Device profiling data exists in the system
User has access to the dashboard
test_steps: Log in to the application
Navigate to the Profiler Dashboard
Trigger multiple manual refreshes of the dashboard
Verify the data remains consistent across all refreshes
expected_results: Dashboard data remains consistent after multiple refreshes
